metadata.Title: CVE-2023-6039 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in lan78xx_disconnect indrivers/net/usb/lan78xx.c in the network sub-component, net/usb/lan78xx inthe Linux Kernel. This flaw allows a local attacker to crash the systemwhen the LAN78XX USB device detaches.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6039` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 6.2.0-38.39
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-38.39
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 6.2.0-38.39
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 6.2.0-38.39
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.2.0-38.39').
linux-kvm package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life').
linux-aws package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oracle package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-raspi package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-starfive package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
